column2: DLW, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After finally discovering that I had iron-deficiency anemia and otc iron was not workiing; my physician put me on repliva.  Within the first week of being on it, I felt better than I had in two years.  I did not experience any side effects.  I finally had energy.  I felt like the "old me".

column2: gwynne, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: stomach discomfort,pain and I have to applyheat and lay down.

column2: iziemae, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Been taking for over a year and very satisfied - no problems.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I went to the ER with a hemoglobin of 3.8 and had one pint transfused.  Someone told me about Repliva 21/7 so I requested a prescription.  By April, my hemoglobin was 13.6.  As soon as I stopped taking it, my blood started dropping again (I have crohn's disease).  The next time I received a generic.  It did not seem  to be as effective and it is much harder on my system.  Repliva 21/7 did not bother me anywhere as much as the name brand.  Since then, they seem to give me a new generic each time and each time it seems harder to take.  The pharmacist tells me he can't get the name brand.  Insurance didn't cover Repliva so I paid cash for it.  They cover the generic but I'd rather pay for it if I could get the real thing.

column2: melsolis@bisd.us, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been very anemia for years. Have tried different medication. None worked! Now, I am 35years old with the same problem. I went back to the doctor because I couldn't take it anymore. I was so tired all the time. The doctor gave me Repliva. I worked great. Now I am sad because they don't have the medication. It has a recall.

column2: av5nd4,  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: NEW TREATMENT

column2: concerned Female, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Repliva for over 3 years now. I tried to stop couple of times, but I went tofeeling bad again. Repliva was originally prescribed by my OBGYN. After my family doctor told me I had to be admitted to the hospital for blood transfusion. My hemoglobin was 7.??Well after I took this medication, it went up to 11.0. Which is huge difference. I absolutely love the fact that it does not have any side effects on me. Recently the pharmacy gave me a generic name. and told me that the manufacture did not make any money, and they closed down. Let me tell you it is not the same at all. I am feeling bad again. As matter of fact worst. My fingers are numb always. I have difficulties everyday. They feel like piece of wood. and its real painful. I wish they bring Repliva Again. It was super.

column2: bellringe, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had Gastric Bypass surgery in 2000, and had an ongoing iron defeciency, until starting Repliva 21/7, and I have not been able to find a decent, substitute that my body can absorb. I am so tired all the time! Someone. please help?

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been on the repliva for about 2 months my iron level has increased from 9 to 11.8. Although I take it at night I've had some severe stomach cramps and diarreah some mornings. But as compared to most iron replacements I have tried these side effects are minimal and not unbearable.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I've had a lifelong problem with iron absorption and could not find an iron supplement that worked.  Today, at 65, I finally have energy to do whatever I want.

column2: appleofhiseye, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a gastric bypass patient with low iron. this is my 2nd month, no issues or pain, I hate the big packaging... my surgeon prescribed it and I trust him with it. I wont get blood tests again for another couple months, will post again then. For now no issues, just the dark stool. I was told at one pharmacy it was discontinued went to Walmart and they had it and still have it there :-D

column2: earthwitch68, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My OBGYN gave me samples of this medication as it was discovered that I am anemic.  I don't experience any side effects - but I have not noticed an increase in energy as I was hoping to and I have had a very poor appetite as well.  After reading the other comments I was surprised that this medication was recalled.  I have another appt with dr today to see if she is aware.

column2: Ann, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have only taken samples given to me by my OB/GYN. I have taken it less than a month but I am feeling much better. I am out of samples and can't find the medication.

column2: KOOLAID, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I WAS ON REPLIVA FOR ABOUT 6 MTHS AND TRIED TA GET ANOTHER REFILL AND TOLD THERE WAS A RECALL. MAJOR BUMMER!!!!!  IT WORKED WONDERS!!!!!

column2: docsnurse, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I love this drug and have been SO unhappy since I found it was recalled.  I started it two years ago after having duodenal switch surgery and I have had no anemia complications.  I take it at bedtime, on an empty stomach.  If I have any alcohol, I wait an hour before taking it.  I have noticed the darker stools, but that happens with any iron supplementation, so I'm not alarmed or upset by that.  With the recall, I had to be off it for three weeks and I really noticed the difference in my energy level. I found one pack left at a pharmacy, and despite the recall, I'm back on it and I feel my old self.  That should say something - that I'm more afraid of not being on it than a recall!  I hope the manufacturer gets their act together SOON and either sells the patent or starts manufacturing it again.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: was having multi. blood transfusions,when doctor but me on replvia.no transfusions for 1.5 yrs.

column2: HARA, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: IT SUCKS

column2: twisted1, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have celiac sprue gluten dasease.  I was given this because my body was litterallyrejecting nurishment, losing over 60 pd 1yr.I wheigh 86 pd. Problem is the stomach cramps are so severe I can't straighten out of fetal postion. I have to RUN to bathroom & pray I make it! I'm so hungry all the timeI am literally sick no matter how much I eat or how often, which is constantly and as much as I can shove in my mouth at a time! They are so big they get caught going down and hurt severly till either they do go or dessolve.  My problem is I HAVE TO take them because my illness is killing me. If I don't do this as part of medicine I could be dead in 2 years.  So what do you do?  The only other option is IV iron and I get enough of those. I am hoping that symtoms go away and things work out. I really don't have any other choice for recovery. The other problem is I can't leavemy house because of needing the bathroom constantly, anything I eat or drink does not stay for more than 15 min if lucky. Imodiom ad DOSE NOT help! I am hoping since I have ben on them almost 2 months it will soon calm down.

column2: Linda, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: Karen, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with anemia and received 3 pints of blood.  My blood count is just under normal right now, 11.5, but my iron stays at a 4.  My hematologist put me on repliva last month and I hate it!  It makes me dizzy, loss of appetite, stomach pain and tired.  I was not concerned with the bathroom issues since they were expected, but the side effects don't make sense.  Iron is susposto make you have more energy, not less.  I have taken the medication in the morning and at night.  Night is better, but I still feel tired during the day and I colapse by 9:00 pm, after only being awake 13 hours.  Since this is susposto be just vitamins and minerals, dizziness and tiredness doesn't make sense.  The stomach pain and nausea is to be expected.

column2: Rita, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medicine has caused me sever breathingproblems  I DO NOT SUGGEST THAT ANYONE USE IT!!!!!!!!!!!

column2: rose, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I didn't think I was going to have side effects from an iron supplement and it could be that I'm still not experiencing side effects.  I decided to look it up because it's my second day on the med. and I woke up with the worse vertigo (dizzy), the entire room was spinning.  Maybe it causes indigestion because sometimes indigestion gives me vertigo.  I'll keep taking it.  I'll keep you posted.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been off and on this drug for the past year and a half.  I have never had a problem with any side effects.  My doctor prefers me to be on for 3 months then off.  I can tell when my hemoglobin levels drop.  I usually feel better again within 7-10 days after starting this again.  I have been anemic since I was 16 and nothing else has ever worked this well.  My levels were below 8 before I started and now they are back up to 12.  Aside from the expense, I think it is great!

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I had gastric bypas (Roux-en-Y) 08/2006 and have a slight anemia since.  My biggest complaint is the ridiculous packaging!  I'm an adult and can take a pill out of a bottle when I'm suppose too.  I'll give it a longer chance but I am sceptical...

column2: S_Feelinbetter247, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Out of all the Iron Therapy Medications I have used, Repliva is the best one for me. I have a lot of energy and feel great. one thing I do not like about this medication is that, it increases your appetite. Unfortunately, I have gained 23 pounds since stating the medication 8 months ago.
